definition: candidate who came third in the Han-lin examination/see 狀元|状元[zhuang4 yuan2]
to explore/to search out/to scout/to visit/to stretch forward
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
surname Hua
old variant of 花[hua1]
variant of 花[hua1]/flower/blossom/also pr. [wei3]

sentences.english: Apricot Garden was also the place where the successful candidates of the imperial civil examination would give banquets to celebrate their success.
sentences.chinese: 杏园也是唐代新科进士举行杏园探花宴的场所。

sentences.english: No. 3 is from the seaport of Sakai, south of Osaka.
sentences.chinese: 探花来自大阪南部的堺市。

definition: candidate who came second in the Han-lin examination/see 狀元|状元[zhuang4 yuan2]

top scorer in the palace examination (highest rank of the Imperial examination system)/see 榜眼[bang3 yan3] and 探花[tan4 hua1]/top scorer in college entrance examination 高考[gao1 kao3]/(fig.) the most brilliantly talented person in the field/leading light
first-placed candidate in the provincial imperial examinations (old)
successful candidate in the highest imperial civil service examination/palace graduate
refers to academics employed as imperial secretaries from the Tang onwards, forming the Hanlin Imperial Academy 翰林院
graduate/successful candidate in the imperial provincial examination
title of the temporary position in the Hanlin Academy, conferred to meritorious candidates until the next examination
a person who has passed the county level imperial exam (historical)/scholar/skillful writer/fine talent
candidate who ranked 1st in imperial examination on prefecture or county level (in Ming and Qing dynasties)
to pass an exam
court examination, the top grade imperial exam
to pass the provincial level imperial examination
(old) candidate who has successfully passed the first grades of the examination system, but not yet the court examination (殿試|殿试[dian4 shi4])
candidate for the Imperial Examination proposed by a tributary state
the triennial provincial imperial exam during the Ming and Qing
1st rank or top three candidates who passed the imperial examination (i.e. 狀元|状元[zhuang4 yuan2], 榜眼[bang3 yan3], and 探花[tan4 hua1], respectively)
